posts.name: Sbeaty Signal
posts.cooked:
Hello!

My name’s Scott Beaty and I recently joined Signal as a designer. One of the first things I’m beginning to take a look at is voice notes, and to help the team get a better understanding of how voice notes are used by members of the community, we’ve put together a short survey—which is completely optional, of course.

Any help is greatly appreciated, and if you’d prefer to submit answers or comments on voice notes via Signal, you can send them to +1 803-816-2742.

Here’s the link to the survey: https://forms.gle/6ViZsfe3kp8hUhGZ8

If you’re not a voice note user, fear not—I’ll be back before long with questions about something else

Truly looking forward to working together with the members of the Signal community,
Scott

link_counts.title: Where are the Signal designers on this forum?
Add settings for proximity sensor behavior
Display the length of a voice message
Dedicated improvement survey for every existing options on Signal
Problem listening voice messages
Sending a message without adding to contacts list
Option to hide message preview in chat list (per chat?)

posts.cooked:
Hi Scott, it’s great to see more talented people joining the Signal team and even more so, people that liaise with the user base.

I’ve submitted a response to your form.
My main issue is that if disappearing messages are set, the timer starts counting from ‘viewing’ the message in the conversation, rather than from playing it. If I don’t manage to listen to the message and the timer runs out, I lose it.

posts.name: Sbeaty Signal
posts.cooked:
Hi Dino,

Great to meet you and thanks for submitting a response. Yes, the disappearing message issue is an interesting one, for sure—it’s on my radar!

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: Will that number above be only for voice notes issues or usability in general as time goes on? Great to see you on the team. As an old textsecure user I’m really excited to see the growth!

posts.name: Sbeaty Signal
posts.cooked: Hey Jeremy—nice to meet you! For now the number is an alternative for people who’d prefer to talk about voice notes using Signal, but we’ll be using the same number (or a different number for the same purpose) whenever we’re looking for feedback/thoughts/etc in a specific area.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: Essentially I use them when I don’t have time to type. An intersection at a red light, or when I know i need to convey something with my voice that text just doesn’t fully encapsulate.
I don’t use them extensively, but my most common usage is with myself (via “Note to self”) if I need to save something for later that is more quickly spoken than typed.

posts.name: ⚠️ abandoned account ⚠️
posts.cooked:
jfyi, some feature requests regarding voice notes (there’s probably more):

Display the length of a voice message Android Feature Requests
Hey, is there a way to add the length of voice messages (like in the ios version)? The length would have to be known anyway so this should not be a major problem. (Signal 4.19.3 on Android 7.1.1) Greetings
Audio message played / listened to indicator (similar to the read receipt) Feature Requests
Add a symbol that indicates whether an audio message has been played or not. WhatsApp has that little icon that turns blue in addition to the read receipt.
Show an indicator when someone is recording a voice message Feature Requests
I haven’t seen it mentioned, so i’m going to bring it up. I find typing indicators to be extremely useful. I believe speaking (audio) indicators would be just as useful. As it currently stands, Signal does not show any indicator for when people are talking. In addition to the typing indicator that is already present, I am proposing the addition of an indicator that shows when people are recording a voice (audio) message. Below is a suggested appearance of the audio message indicator. [Audio%…
Disappearing timer should start after listening to a voice message Android Support
It often happens that I can quickly skim through messages in a chat during working hours, but I cannot listen to voice messages until I get home. If I ‘read’ the voice messages e.g. in the morning, alongside the written messages, the timer will start counting, and if it’s set to a low value, the voice messages will have disappeared by the time I get home. Therefore I would like to suggest that the timer for voice messages specifically should start counting down from the moment the message is p…
Generate text transcript of voice notes Feature Requests
I hate listening to voice notes. But some of my friends love sending voice notes – sometimes to me! In my dreams, there would be a small button below a voice note, which I can tap, and then the message bubble expands and shows the text of this voice note (generated by speech recognition from the audio file). I know this may be technically challenging, but I would love to have this feature . Is a messenger out there which already offers this functionality?

link_counts.title: Disappearing timer should start after listening to a voice message

posts.name: Sbeaty Signal
posts.cooked: Thanks @p4nci. I’ve seen these in various places, but really helpful to have them all in one spot.

DonDino:

My main issue is that if disappearing messages are set, the timer starts counting from ‘viewing’ the message in the conversation, rather than from playing it. If I don’t manage to listen to the message and the timer runs out, I lose it.

Very very very important.

Also this one here:

Allow to switch to ear speaker while connected to Bluetooth Feature Requests
Would be nice if you can hold the phone to your ear and listen to voice message while connected to Bluetooth. Basically let the phone speaker work while on ear.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
Lets not forget that improvements on playback are just as important as recording itself:

Better audio playback Feature Requests
There are a number of disappointments when listening to Signal voice messages on iOS: When listening to a voice message in Signal, playback stops as soon as I close the app. Instead, playback should continue in the background while I’m doing other things. During voice playback, the music controls in Control Center do not reflect this playback. Instead, I want to be able to play, pause and scrub from Control Center. The playback indicator on voice messages inside Signal looks like a scru…

link_counts.title: Better audio playback

posts.cooked:
sbeaty-signal:

If you’re not a voice note user

I hate them ;-) But lots of people like them. My top3 priority-recommendations:

  1. when Alice cryptocalls Bob, and gets a busy-tone, she should be prompted

    • Bob +2-222-222-2222 is on another call,
      you can press&hold
      to record a voiceNote instead, if you wish
      [Got_It]    [DoNotShowThisAgain]

    • cf, Voicemail/Mailbox in Signal - #9 by Halcyon

    • same sort of popup makes sense, if Bob does not answer, or if Bob’s device is in airplane mode, or if one of them is using Tor and the jitter is too high to let cryptocalls function properly, etc… reminder to fallback to voiceNotes

  2. serious bug, Voice messages received from Android are rapidly sped up

Mark Zuckerberg: "A Privacy-Focused Vision for Social Networking"

(playStore review by Joshua Hayden) …Pixel 3 to iPhone: voice messages play at double speed. bug reports, contacted company, zero response. Not a minor annoyance for a rare use case; major functional flaw between two flagships

  • “we believe it is a Pixel/Android bug” per Voice message send from pixel 3 plays 2x the normal speed · Issue #4184 · signalapp/Signal-iOS · GitHub (nine days ago)
    • pick a container-format which does not exhibit/exacerbate the bug
    • pick an audio-codec (or codec-settings) which do not trigger the bug
  1. platform-parity mismatch between signal4android (mono-aural speech-quality settings for the codec) versus signal4desktop and signal4ios (much higher audio-quality settings for the codec … quintuples the filesize of voiceNotes but permits transmission of songs/music/etc … singing happy birthday to the nieces, sending a part of a rock concert to grandpa, and of course, the most common thing, crooning a love song over the wire to a love-interest. Which I think everybody should do using signalapp, obviously… it’s private, after all.
  • decide if music-quality 44khz stereo-audio IS to be supported
    • if yes, make ALL clients transmit beautiful music, damn the kbps count
    • if nay, STOP wasting bandwidth & storage-space for voiceNotes
    • else, give enduser the option to send CD-quality vs PSTN-quality
    • someday, auto-detect if transmission is music vs speech, adjust kbps on-the-fly, should be possible if you pick Opus as winning codec (see next point)
  • ideally-ideally, pick a single portable libre codec AND container-format (not 3!)
    • Opus/Vorbis Audio Compression
    • Monitoring Data usage - #16 by 5_c_d

p.s. My wishlist item for the long-run is pure-client-side speech-to-text. Handy when full-text-searching for a message, later on.

p.p.s. I’d also like to be able to put my device in “only-voiceNote” mode, and thenceforth have it use pure-client-side text2speech to convert incoming textual-messages into verbalization for me. Handy when driving. “Greetings, Professor Falken…”

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: Another way I thought of is…I know the other person can’t type or listen right now…but I have enough to say I don’t want to type…So a voice note works great for this. Basically if I want to leave a message like a voice mail really.

posts.name: Adam Parish
posts.cooked: My first reaction is, “voice notes???” I didn’t know that was a feature.

Adam_Parish:

I didn’t know

This is actually probably right up Scott Beaty’s alley… how do we make features discoverable so that endusers will be aware of them? A friend of mine was angry because they could not find a particular imagefile in signalapp, and wishing there was a place where all the imagefiles were stored, and was so glad when I told them about the All Media thing.

They had probably seen it in the menu before, or maybe not (rarely to people need to go into the signalapp menu unless hunting something specific).

VoiceNotes are “right there” … but they are hidden in plain sight. The grey microphone-icon is stuck in between the (larger and with a big expanse of whitespace to illuminate it) camera-icon for quick photo-capture, and on the other side, the bright blue (+) for file-attachments. Most people when they look at the send-message-area, are going to be looking at the place where they tap to send a textual message. They might never notice the little microphone-icon, or they might assume it is for voiceCommands or speech2text (neither of which is implemented within signalapp at present) rather than for voiceNotes.

Should signalapp go old-school, and have some kind of tip-of-the-day, like desktop applications in the 1980s when everything had a built-from-scratch UI with idiosyncratic UI-conventions? We are back to that again, sorta. Maybe the first time a person receives a voiceNote, they get a popup explaining “tap on play to hear your voiceNote… you can reply in a textual-message, or tap-n-hold the microphone-icon to send a voiceNote of your own”.

5_c_d:

have some kind of tip-of-the-day

And here I thought I was the only one who still doesn’t click on ‘never show again’ on these ‘Tip of the day’ windows, just in case anything interesting ever comes up

posts.name: Johanw666
posts.cooked:
DonDino:

And here I thought I was the only one who still doesn’t click on ‘never show again’ on these ‘Tip of the day’ windows, just in case anything interesting ever comes up

Signal is open source: I would click on “never show again”, and look in the source for the list of possible messages. Then I’d see any new ones in the commit log.

Here are my 2 cents (Android):

  • Make length of voice notes visible
  • Screen goes off when listening to longer voice notes (normal screen timeout
    set by OS)
  • The ‘swipe to lock’ conflicts with the gesture navigation of e.g. the Pixel 4
  • If you swipe up and down while playing a voice note, the ‘play / stop’ icon animation is triggered.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
Leibi:

The ‘swipe to lock’ conflicts with the gesture navigation of e.g. the Pixel 4

Exactly, it can still happen although this issue was closed:

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Impossible to lock voice note with Q fully gestural nav

opened 04:27PM - 11 Jul 19 UTC
closed 01:08AM - 09 Nov 19 UTC
awaitlink

### Bug description It is impossible to "lock" voice note recording when the An…droid Q fully gestural navigation is used unless the keyboard is visible. ### Steps to reproduce - Select conversation. - Make sure keyboard is hidden. - Hold "record voice note" button. - Slide up as prompted to "lock" the recording. **Actual result:** Android starts going to the Home screen **and** the unfinished voice note is sent by Signal if its length reaches the "anti-tap" threshold. **Expected result:** The voice note recording is "locked". ### Screen capture [![1]][1] [1]: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19972511/61067864-4de89c00-a411-11e9-8034-953a19c0eace.gif ### Device info **Device:** Pixel 3 XL **Android version:** Q Beta 4 **Signal version:** 4.43.8

link_counts.title: Impossible to lock voice note with Q fully gestural nav · Issue #8918 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub
